@Motherhector I know. It's crazy. And not great for the environment but I don't know what'll happen re EU flights, holidays and work post-Brexit so I'm jumping at the opportunity while it's easy - and luckily my bestie is the illustrator and has a bed for me too 🖤
RT @jamesglynn: Have the self belief of this llama taking a taxi. https://t.co/aVYHgTdJAg
@MonstrousRgmt I like it. Lamps on at home, lots of reading, Xmas socialising/energy pressures still held at bay, and my body moves into its comfort zones of hearty food & cosy clothes. 🖤
@jennifergracen I’m packing comfy clothes & big coffee intentions. ♥️ How are you sweetheart? X
RT @jennifergracen: Read this whole thread, ladies -- great new place that wants to lovingly empower women and their stories. Perhaps yours…

Nicest to-do list for next 2 wks. Pitching a piece I’m loving writing, going to France to put poems & illustrations together & talk design & life while staring at the Pyrenees (thank you, Ryanair, £25 return flight). Then, home to edit & publish new stories for #TheGrantidote. 🖤
@RobOnABike Coconut milk, or similar? Wee brush of warm veg oil?
@PoorFrankRaw Goddamm if she was a vegan I’d have taken her.

@RenataFlitworth Gentle hugs. Well done for saying it out, that’s hard but will doubtless already have helped a bit. I’ve been thru something similar recently onset by stress spikes. 3 weeks of being kind to myself, resting more & talking about it has helped reset the neurochems. X
@DIfferent_Name2 SO MUCH TIME THO https://t.co/mieLfUkpfI
@PoorFrankRaw Awwwwww! I’ll take Tootsie, no bother.
@littlerachyb Good woman 🥇
@PoorFrankRaw 😂 Tootsie!
@littlerachyb Thoughts & prayers ♥️
@DIfferent_Name2 Yeah 🖤 Skirtings will be the same, oak floor to match doors & worktops (2019 🤞🏼). The colours are coming out so restful. Chuffed :-)))
@PoorFrankRaw You’re selfless Frank. Eat it while watching Okja, with BBQ sauce. https://t.co/aJ7tQSHap6
Also making soup and whooping about hanging our first new door and fitting the retro handles that whisk me back to 1979 like a proper Timelordess. I 🖤 Sundays. https://t.co/Czx7wtfGUb

@bellabasilicata Lovely... 💙

Going off recipe piste on last weekends’ cinnamon buns. Couldn’t bear the sad eyes of vegans who couldn’t dunk them in coffee too so have swapped out yoghurt for mashed banana to see how that goes.... https://t.co/zFbKJcnO8N
@sonnyandluca @TatMum_Blog 😂 I reversed into a bollard a few years ago. The bumper and I were equally crushed & devastated tbh.

@sonnyandluca @TatMum_Blog < Also, if (understandably) wary about buying privately, the AA do these checks; https://t.co/CbMouDT8TI, not sure how useful this is, I'd always want to see & hear a car moving through gears before buying. 'One (provable) lady owner' does tend to be a good thing, tbh.

@sonnyandluca @TatMum_Blog I negotiated a deal like this from Hyundai for my Mum and it was great - she had no time/energy to manage garage repairs etc. and we struck a finance deal where she could return the car and quit the agreement with no penalty if she felt out of her depth. >

@sonnyandluca @TatMum_Blog Ok this'll sound odd at first but I would consider a new car like a Skoda Citigo. Deposit of around £170 then finance at around £110 pcm. Warranty/new means no repairs then hand back & walk when you're done - you'll make no profit but also no loss, compared to used/needy car.
@sonnyandluca Budget wise, what we talking? And how long will you need the car? Is it a forever from now thing, or for a year or two?
@LenLenington OMG I so want this for my kids in future. 🖤 How lovely. X
@seagullworrier Thank you for finding the silver lining 😂👍🏼

@seagullworrier No, honestly, I was a more terrible daughter, I promise. I didn’t even let my mum come to my wedding. It was supposed to be a formality and it ended up looking more like a wedding and she wasn’t there and I am truly awful regrets forevs times infinity... https://t.co/BUJoCzCw2d
RT @TheGrantidote: A stormy day calls for #Bongde & #GabJangGran. So much love here; https://t.co/oOZsEXOqDq #TheGrantidote #SouthKorea #Wo…

@seagullworrier OHMAGAWD. I remember I couldn’t look at my mum when I was leaving. My heart was splitting in two at the thought of her alone. I did tell daughter last night that she could never leave now, so there’s that, at least.

RT @FidraFineArt: Last weekend...closes tomorrow at 5. Open in #Gullane today 11-5, 12-5 Sun.
#AstridTrügg - On a Table III - Monoprint -…
@Kirsty_CSk Ugh, that’s awful :-( Hugs to you too. X

@seagullworrier That’s lovely you got some time at the weekend. ♥️ I was 21 when I left home, so 18 (just!) feels so fast, I wish I’d squeezed in more with him and now time’s up and I’ll just get snippets. Then again, Mum & I got closer still as years went by. Then again, WAH. 😭
@seagullworrier It won’t be far, still in Edinburgh. Omg I’m such a fud. It feels like a grief tho. I think once I see he’s happy I’ll be fine. Is your eldest enjoying uni so far?

@seagullworrier I’m mystified that something so apparently natural and signalling of success, etc., just feels so weird & so soon. I’m replaying his life from birth on a loop of moments big & small. Urrrgghh :-/
❤️ https://t.co/HHOjwtwzLk
@seagullworrier How're you getting on with eldest away? I was thinking of you today. Manchild getting close to moving into a flat with a friend and my heart is achey.
@EoghanScott We could Quote RT everything with a ♥️ That wouldn’t be annoying at all.

@EoghanScott What are you and me going to do when there's no Twitter likey hearty thing, Eoghan? There's not time to start replying to everything with ❤️ because of bringing down the patriarchy, etc. This a curse on self-expression.

Just spent 2 hrs cleaning showers and toilets and a bathroom cabinet and now I have no guilt whatsoever about whatever the hell the kids are going to have to pick out my false teeth when I’m one hundred and four.
@the3dge0fSan1ty @BootstrapCook It’s new. Give it time. 👍🏼

@Meaddthree NO CATE YOU MAY NOT. But you can make an autumnal leaf garland & light a candle, if you like.
Answer from ‘a friend’.
@sjksanders @PatMcClay @TatMum_Blog @ellen_desmond Tahini’s fine, I’m good with seeds. 👍🏼 It’s legumes & nuts that are my nemesis, hummus is a recurring threat ;-)
@sjksanders @PatMcClay @TatMum_Blog @ellen_desmond Everything apart from me. Severely allergic to that too! The joy of puy.
@MacJude Yeah, on the second bottle of the oil. The first was an almost clear oil & this second bottle is reminiscent of cabbage & kale soup in taste, colour & general desirability! 😷
@sjksanders @PatMcClay @TatMum_Blog @ellen_desmond Oh FFS. :-((
No, quite right. It’s the Republic of Gilead. #UnderHisEye https://t.co/O3lRN9lG24
RT @Oprah: .@TinaTurner has been through the fire recently, one challenge after the other, and came out on the other side “another hero.” A…

@PatMcClay @TatMum_Blog @ellen_desmond I’m sure she knows already but stock up on cetirizine antihistamine - it has stopped things escalating a couple of times for me when I’ve realised I’m chomping down on a hidden allergen (bastard ground pistachios & pea shoots in salads are so 2016/17/18 gggrrr).
RT @TheLastGoodGirl: This is important 👇 https://t.co/tIZzFXn2T8
@TatMum_Blog @PatMcClay @ellen_desmond Thx xx

@PatMcClay @TatMum_Blog @ellen_desmond Yes, do Pat. I instantly worried about my friend’s kids who have all the same allergies as me. Fairly easy to avoid as a food-savvy adult, not so easy at all for teens & kids. :-/ Might see if I can buy a back-up in France next week.
@TatMum_Blog @ellen_desmond Tad worrying. I’m hopefully getting one on Monday - on a waiting list now.

@decenthumanbean @ellen_desmond I know. WTF? I’m now in a queue for one, hoping for pickup on Monday. Pharmacist asked what I did with my old one, I explained it was 2 yrs out of date so I let daughter practice using it by stabbing it into a banana. Apparently I should’ve kept it. Is this Brexit too, or what?!

I had no idea epipens are no longer being freely dispensed. Tried to pick up my new one today on repeat prescription (thx @ellen_desmond for kicking my ass on this) and had to discuss whether I *really* needed one. I mean, who’s been getting them and NOT really needing them?!?!
@AnchorCake @BootstrapCook Yes you can but pls note the poop emoji ones will probs be quite dry. 💩🎻💨
Watching the misbehaviour of my first batch of cinnabuns baking (thanks & praise to @BootstrapCook for the recipe) with complete delight. https://t.co/EWGCe4Rvgw
@lumpinthethroat That’s great, Mairi, pleased to hear it :-))

@Aibagawa Worth speaking to GP or a pharmacist in the know, huh? Potentially this could change things for a lot of people, I think. But it is expensive so I’m just using as an acute remedy but do know folk taking it morning & night and saying it’s making a huge difference.

@Aibagawa Nope. It’s a stress-related thing with me rather than a constant so I use it as a reminder I need to make changes to reduce the stress and, wherever possible, avoid negative stress and drama as if they’re the plague.

So perfect. I remember terrible disassociation with AND & PND and, interestingly, at my Mum’s funeral. A strong element of moving into performance mode when the mind can’t anchor in reality? Wonder what happens at a biochemical level.... 🤔 https://t.co/EpHhLAZW3x

@WWRBGD Interesting. 👍🏼 Son’s using it too as he feels it is helping his scoliosis pain (oral drops) and he’s sleeping more deeply too, thx to that relief. It’s really helped my pal’s Dad’s bad knee as well, rubbed on the skin. Bollocking expensive, tho.
I’ve been trying CBD a bit. Didn’t help my sleep, alas, but definitely helped shutdown wee bouts of anxiety that otherwise would likely have spiralled to consume hrs & energy. https://t.co/0BpK1HzvGk
RT @ScrtDrugAddict: Men who ask “can I even talk to women now” are in fact not allowed to talk to women.

@BelgianGatorade I will, promise. Had a subtle, slow gas leak when we moved in that made me & doggo very ill. There will be absolutely no fucking around with the invisible stuff. 👍🏼
I need a hero. Or just someone who knows how to disconnect gas safely from an old hob and cap unnecessary service pipes at the domestic main. Whevs.
@IndyForEvil Yes. We’re having a Sith Brexit and that’s all there is about it.

@wrathofgod I was reading about the migraine link today. It's bloody interesting. We had a flat for a while where the downstairs neighbour's smoke would come up somehow, through the floorboards and carpet. I thought I was imagining it then left a rm shut all day and came home to a haze :-(
@Jem1358 I reckon the Peel Park Premier Inn nicked it.
@Pols80 @AlRedboots I have almost pissed myself laughing. Poor bloody tree!! 😂
@AlRedboots It's DONE!
@AlRedboots Exactly. It looked like it was bloody levitating. 🧙🏼‍♀️

Is it still within the offside rules of Xmas spirit to get one of those festive projectors and point it at your neighbour’s house rather than your own, so you can share the benefit of it?
